verses.roman:
śūdrāḥ pratigrahīṣyanti
tapo-veṣopajīvinaḥ
dharmaṁ vakṣyanty adharma-jñā
adhiruhyottamāsanam

synonyms: śūdrāḥ—lowly, common workers; pratigrahīṣyanti—will accept religious charity; tapaḥ—by shows of austerity; veṣa—and by dressing as mendicants; upajīvinaḥ—earning their living; dharmam—the principles of religion; vakṣyanti—will speak about; adharma-jñāḥ—those who know nothing about religion; adhiruhya—mounting; uttama-āsanam—a high seat.
translation: Uncultured men will accept charity on behalf of the Lord and will earn their livelihood by making a show of austerity and wearing a mendicant's dress. Those who know nothing about religion will mount a high seat and presume to speak on religious principles.

purport.content: The epidemic of bogus gurus, swamis, priests and so forth is explicitly described here.
